snippet: The stumbles in the rollout of the Obama administration’s health reform are frustrating, but they are not a broad indictment of government.
abstract: Editorial maintains Republicans are seizing the flawed rollout of Affordable Care Act as an opportunity to drag their feet on other White House initiatives like immigration reform and a budget agreement; holds party's lack of viable solutions, and its reliance on obstruction, present a far greater danger to country than temporary mistakes by Democrats.
lead_paragraph: The stumbles in the rollout of the Obama administration’s health reform are frustrating, but they are not a broad indictment of government.

headline.main: A New G.O.P. Excuse for Doing Nothing
headline.print_headline: A New G.O.P. Excuse for Doing Nothing

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
